Detailed Description

A.6. Reference Point Packet.

The "reference point packet" provides a free-form description of a reference point. This class of packet plays a major role in large-scale, run-time-configurable, installations where the exact processing path is not pre-determined.

virtual string vrt::ReferencePointPacket::getFieldName ( int32_t  id  )  const [virtual]

Gets the name of the given field.

In 90% of cases the field name will be identical to the name used in the applicable get/set function except without the get/set prefix (e.g. "SourceContext" for "getSourceContext"). It is possible to access the names of all fields via the following: 

    for (int32_t id = 0; id < getFieldCount(); id++) {
      // id is the field ID
      getFieldName(id);
    }

In situations where it is desirable to access all available fields, it is faster to use the field ID as this eliminates any string comparisons.

Parameters:
id The field ID (on range [0,getFieldCount())).
Returns:
The field name.
Exceptions:
VRTException if the field id is invalid.

Reimplemented from vrt::BasicVRTPacket.

Returns:
The field type (n > 0) or -N if the field is a vector of values where N is the component type of the vector.

virtual string vrt::ReferencePointPacket::getPacketValid ( bool  strict,
int32_t  length 
) const [virtual]

Checks to see if the packet is valid.

This is identical to isPacketValid(int32_t) except that a description of the error is returned.

Parameters:
strict Should strict checking be done, or just enough to verify that things are OK for reading. No packet failing strict checking should ever be sent out, but it may be useful to disable strict checking when reading in a packet.
length Verifies that the length of the packet matches this value.
Returns:
Empty string ("") if it is valid, a description of the error otherwise.

Reimplemented from vrt::BasicVRTPacket.

void vrt::ReferencePointPacket::setName ( string  val  )  [inline]

Set A free-form name of the reference point.


Size: 32

Parameters:
val The new value to write to the packet. Any non-ASCII characters in the string (numeric value >0x7F) or ASCII control characters (numeric value <0x20, 0x7F) will be replaced with '?'. If the string is longer than the size allotted, it will be truncated without warning.

References vrt::BasicVRTPacket::packPayloadAscii().

const string vrt::ReferencePointPacket::CLASS_ID [static]

const int64_t vrt::ReferencePointPacket::CLASS_IDENTIFIER [static]

The class identifier in numeric form (0xFFFFFA20110006).

const int32_t vrt::ReferencePointPacket::PACKET_LENGTH [static]

The packet length (-40) excluding the header and trailer (if applicable).

A value of -40 indicates that the length is variable with a minimum length of 40 octets.

const PacketType vrt::ReferencePointPacket::PACKET_TYPE [static]

The packet type (PacketType_ExtContext).
